home.title: Home
home.description: Welcome to Sanggar Seni Mupu Art Dance Website, Empowering the Young Generation Through Balinese Dance and Noble Cultural Heritage.

benefit.title: Benefits of Learning Balinese Dance
benefit.description: Learning Balinese dance not only teaches movements but also enriches the soul and culture. By learning Balinese dance, you will experience deep benefits in your daily life.

items.title: Experienced Instructor
items.description: Practice directly with professional instructors who are graduates of ISI Bali and experts in Balinese dance arts.

items.title: Cultural Expression Stage
items.description: Opportunities to perform in cultural showcases at regional, district, provincial, and even national levels.

items.title: Guidance and Preservation
items.description: Be part of a young generation actively preserving culture and developing self-potential through art.

items.title: Tari Pendet
items.description: Tari Pendet is a traditional Balinese welcoming dance typically performed by female dancers carrying flower-filled bowls. It symbolizes greetings and respect for guests or deities descending to Earth.

items.title: Tari Condong
items.description: Tari Condong is a prelude dance in the Legong performance. Its graceful and expressive movements depict a maid accompanying a princess, often used as basic training for beginner dancers in Bali.

items.title: Tari Baris
items.description: Tari Baris is a traditional Balinese warrior dance performed by male dancers. It features bold and powerful movements that reflect a warrior's courage and readiness on the battlefield.

items.title: Tari Puspanjali
items.description: Tari Puspanjali is a modern welcoming dance created as a tribute to guests. Performed by a group of female dancers, it blends classical movements with grace and charm.

items.title: Tari Wirayuda
items.description: Tari Wirayuda depicts a battalion of royal soldiers preparing to defend the homeland. Performed by male dancers, it showcases unity, strength, and heroism.

aboutus.title: About Us
aboutus.description:
Sanggar Seni Mupu Art Dance is a center for traditional Balinese dance training dedicated to preserving culture through training, performances, and character education. We provide dance training for all ages, from children to adults, with a professional approach rooted in cultural heritage. Dances taught include Tari Pendet, Condong, Baris, Puspanjali, Wirayuda, as well as several contemporary and creative dances.

Through regular events like level tests, temple performances, and intensive training programs, Sanggar Seni Mupu Art Dance serves as a space for the younger generation to learn, grow, and contribute to keeping Balinese culture alive and thriving.

items.title: Ni Putu Yayang Lorensia Novita, S.Pd.
items.description: Owner and instructor, graduate of ISI Bali, with expertise in teaching Balinese cultural arts.

items.title: MUPUFEST #1: BALI-WIDE DANCE COMPETITION
items.desc: MUPUFEST #1 was a successful dance competition across Bali hosted by Sanggar Seni Mupu Art Dance. It became a platform for youth to showcase their talent and love for Balinese dance in a competitive yet respectful and communal environment. More than just a competition, it was a gathering space for art lovers, culture preservers, and creative communities. Due to high enthusiasm, MUPUFEST is now an annual sanggar agenda with fresh concepts and energy each year.

items.title: ANNUAL LEVEL-UP EVENT
items.desc: The Level-Up Event is an annual milestone for each student of Sanggar Seni Mupu Art Dance. In this event, students showcase what they've learned over the past year in front of instructors, parents, and guests. Through evaluations, students meeting the criteria are promoted to the next level. This event is both a performance and a celebration of each student's dedication, discipline, and growth in learning Balinese dance.

items.title: INTERSCHOOL COMPETITIONS & REGULAR TEMPLE PERFORMANCES
items.desc: Inter-school competitions and regular temple offerings (ngayah) are consistent activities held by the sanggar. Competitions train students' confidence and apply skills learned. Temple performances serve as devotion and cultural preservation. In every performance, students proudly express their training with responsibility and respect for Balinese spiritual and cultural traditions.
